roleset.name: copy
roleset.note: REPRODUCE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls other_cos-45.4. (from reproduce.01-v)
REPRODUCTION-N NOTES: Based on verb entry reproduce.01; corresponds to Vncls other_cos-45.4. (from reproduction.01-n)

example.name: active
example.text: Twenty years later, two California academics, Stanley Cohen and Herbert Boyer, made ``recombinant'' DNA, transplanting a toad's gene into bacteria, which-1 then *trace*-1 reproduced toad genes.

example.name: passive, poetry
example.text: The effete Tyrannosaurus Rex / Had strict Cretaceous views on sex,/ And that is why you only see him-1 / Reproduced *trace*-1 in the museum.

example.name: Within LVC, all args
example.text: Lu asked Liu for advice about people-1 qualified *PRO*-1 to do reproductions of ancient pottery .

roleset.name: able to be copied
roleset.note: REPRODUCIBLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-Tmprl1to8. Relation to 'reproduce.01'. (from reproducible.01-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: Abdomen : Minimal epigastric discomfort on palpation which-1 [*-1] was no reproducible .
